title: Estadio Nuevo Colombino
text:
Estadio Nuevo Colombino is a <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> in <a href="Huelva">Huelva</a>, <a href="Spain">Spain</a>. It is currently used mostly for <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> matches and is the home ground of <a href="Recreativo%20de%20Huelva">Recreativo de Huelva</a>. Football was first introduced to Spain in Huelva and it still hosts the annual <a href="Trofeo%20Colombino">Trofeo Colombino</a>, one of the traditional curtain-raisers to the Spanish football season. With a capacity of 21,670 seats, it is the 29th-largest stadium in Spain and the 6th-largest in <a href="Andalusia">Andalusia</a>. Opened in 2001, it replaced <a href="Estadio%20Colombino">Estadio Colombino</a>.
Estadio Nuevo Colombino hosted a <a href="Spain%20National%20Football%20Team">Spain</a> international match on 15 November 2014, a European Championship Qualifying match against <a href="Belarus%20national%20football%20team">Belarus</a>.
